item.title: Why The Smart WAN Beats A Dumb Pipe
item.description:
Wide Area Networks (WANs) are traditionally built using “dumb pipes,” which are simple bandwidth connections between two points. These connections are efficient at their primary function: transferring data packets. However, as IT requirements become more complex, there’s a growing need for more intelligent solutions. This can be achieved by either enhancing your internal IT capabilities or outsourcing these needs as a service. Level 3 Communications, a leading provider of fiber network services, recognizes this shift from basic to high-performance networking demands...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-the-smart-wan-beats-a-dumb-pipe/
